headline: Chicken Chile Verde Pressure Cooker Recipe

author.name: J. Kenji López-Alt
author.description: Kenji is the former culinary director for Serious Eats and a current culinary consultant for the site. He is also a New York Times food columnist and the author of The Food Lab: Better Home Cooking Through Science.
knowsAbout: Food science, Recipe development, Equipment reviews, Restaurant reviews , General food features

description: This pressure cooker green chili chicken (chile verde) recipe is a fast, easy weeknight meal, loaded with peppers, onions, and tender chicken.
name: Chicken Chile Verde Pressure Cooker Recipe
keywords: chicken, chile verde, chili, easy, green chili, low carb, quick, tomatillo
recipeIngredient: 3 pounds bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs and drumsticks
1 pound poblano peppers, roughly chopped, seeds and stems discarded (about 3 peppers)
12 ounces tomatillos, husks discarded, quartered (about 4 tomatillos)
10 ounces white onion, roughly chopped (about 1 medium)
6 ounces Anaheim or Cubanelle peppers, roughly chopped, seeds and stems discarded (about 2 peppers)
2 Serrano or jalapeño peppers, roughly chopped, stems discarded
1 tablespoon whole cumin seeds, toasted and ground
1/2 cup loosely packed fresh cilantro leaves and fine stems, plus more for garnish
1 tablespoon Asian fish sauce, such as Red Boat
Fresh corn tortillas and lime wedges, for serving

recipeInstructions.text: Combine chicken, poblano peppers, tomatillos, onion, Anaheim peppers, Serrano peppers, garlic, cumin, and a big pinch of salt in a pressure cooker. Heat over high heat until gently sizzling, then seal pressure cooker, bring to high pressure, and cook for 15 minutes. Release pressure.

Using tongs, transfer chicken pieces to a bowl and set aside. Add cilantro and fish sauce to remaining contents of pressure cooker. Blend with an immersion blender or in a countertop blender and season to taste with salt. Return chicken to sauce, discarding skin and bones and shredding if desired.
Transfer to a serving platter, garnish with chopped cilantro, and serve immediately with tortillas and lime wedges.

review.reviewBody: Made this tonight—even my picky eater husband liked it! Used boneless skinless breasts-might cook a minute or two less next time. Added kernels from three ears of corn when returning the shredded chicken to the sauce. Topped with some avocado and lime—super good!

This is an absolutely fantastic recipe ... I have been searching for a great Chicken Chile Verde recipe for years, and my search is now complete! Even better, it is very quick to prepare with an Instant Pot. I used skinless and boneless chicken breasts (quartered) for quicker preparation and faster shredding in a bowl with a couple of forks. The fish sauce is a great addition for extra depth and umami without any fishy flavor.

I love this recipe. We’re in zone 5 and have grown tomatillos and the peppers successfully. Tomatillos are beautiful plants—but note that you need to grow more than one (they do not self-fertilize!). You may be better off buying seedlings.
I have made this in my Instant Pot multiple times now and it’s been a success every time. So quick and easy, it’s a dream recipe. Don’t leave out the fish sauce - it makes all the difference.
